conclusion: Understand properties of light refraction at air-water boundary.
Solid line represents boundary between air and water; light travels from A to B.
Law of refraction: angle of incidence equals angle of refraction.
Angle of incidence at A equals angle of refraction at B.
Angle of incidence at A equals angle of incidence at B.
Light beam maintains same angle at B; point O is intersection for both A and B.
Point O is intersection of lines AB and boundary.
O1 point is to the right of O point and on the boundary.
Solid line represents boundary between air and water.
O1 point is to the right of O point and on the boundary.
